result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shane R. Schweigel

records.addlTxt:
No illegal use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. 
No possession of dangerous weapons.
Defendant to apply with Public Defender within 7 days at 715-536-9105.

3:13 PM/ RM 203. Defendant Shane R. Schweigel appeared by video, in custody in Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Elizabeth Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties. Court questions State regarding Count 1. State notes wrong repeater enhancer was entered and moves to amend Count 1 on the criminal complaint to reflect 939.62(1)(b). Court receives amendment. Def. given Atty rights and given 4 options, PD, hire own, court appointed Atty. or represent self. Def. does wish to attain counsel. Defendant to apply with Public Defender within 7 days at 715-536-9105. State notes no victim in case and notes Def. is currently on a probation hold. State gives bail bond recommendations and requests a $2,500.00 cash bond with conditions of No illegal use or possession of controlled substances, No possession of dangerous weapons and Defendant to apply with Public Defender within 7 days at 715-536-9105. State has been in contact with Def. probation agent. Def. has no argument. Court orders $2,500.00 cash bond with conditions of No illegal use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription, No possession of dangerous weapons and Defendant to apply with Public Defender within 7 days at 715-536-9105. Court questions if Def. would like to waive time limits on P.H.  Def. waives time limits on P.H. Court accepts waiver of time limits.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
